lines.text: Is it true he had eight hundred and fifty-seven affairs in three years?
lines.character: The Impostor

lines.text: To be exact, nine hundred and three.
lines.character: Leporello

lines.text: All girls are different. All wives are alike.
lines.character: Don Juan

lines.text: Marriage is like a beleaguered city. Those that are out want to get in; those that are in want to get out.
lines.character: Don Juan

lines.text: Lovely little girl!
lines.character: Don Juan

lines.text: She'd look awful by daylight.
lines.character: Leporello

lines.text: Well, who wants to see her by daylight?
lines.character: Don Juan

lines.text: You stupid goose! You bloodless cow!
lines.character: Pepita, Another Dancer of Equal Temperament

lines.text: My eyes closed. My heart stopped. My, my everything stopped. What a kiss! What a kiss. What a kiss.
lines.character: Pepita, Another Dancer of Equal Temperament

lines.text: Lovely? When did you tell her that she was lovely? When did you send her a basket of flowers? When did you whisper words that sent shivers up-and-down her spine? Not for years. Because, you were married. You just owned her. Like a monkey, a fiddle! So that a miserable bungler could come and take her away from you. Why should a lovely wife be faithful to you? Clown! Yokel! Boob! Husband!
lines.character: Don Juan

lines.text: What divine hair. And those two lovely stars. Just a little frightened, gazing at me. You baffle me. Once again I'm just a frightened child. Oh, I could kill you for being so attractive.
lines.character: Don Juan

lines.text: What a fool I was! What a fool!
lines.character: Antonita, a Dancer of Passionate Temperament

lines.text: Why?
lines.character: Don Juan

lines.text: I thought I could resist you.
lines.character: Antonita, a Dancer of Passionate Temperament

lines.text: Can you?
lines.character: Don Juan

lines.text: No woman could.
lines.character: Antonita, a Dancer of Passionate Temperament

lines.text: Full?
lines.character: Antonita, a Dancer of Passionate Temperament

lines.text: No, empty. They've all gone over to the Golden Pheasant to see Pepita.
lines.character: Manager of The Black Cat

lines.text: Pepita? That old apple horse!
lines.character: Antonita, a Dancer of Passionate Temperament

lines.text: Old?
lines.character: Manager of The Black Cat

lines.text: Twenty-six, at least. I'm nineteen! And I can dance. She can't.
lines.character: Antonita, a Dancer of Passionate Temperament

lines.text: And who are you to give orders here?
lines.character: Pepita, Another Dancer of Equal Temperament

lines.text: Who am I? Don Juan said I was the girl who's kisses he'd been seeking on a thousand women's lips. I was the only one! He'd never loved anybody else, in his life, but me.
lines.character: Antonita, a Dancer of Passionate Temperament

lines.text: Ha! He loved you so much he went straight from you to another woman?
lines.character: Pepita, Another Dancer of Equal Temperament

lines.text: Oh, that was a previous engagement!
lines.character: Antonita, a Dancer of Passionate Temperament

lines.text: But, that's why they killed him.
lines.character: Pepita, Another Dancer of Equal Temperament

lines.text: That's why they killed him? Because he loved me! He said, Good Night Antonita. I'll tell her, if I have to die for it. He loved me. And loathed on women like you!
lines.character: Antonita, a Dancer of Passionate Temperament

lines.text: Cat!
lines.character: Pepita, Another Dancer of Equal Temperament

lines.text: Cow!
lines.character: Antonita, a Dancer of Passionate Temperament

lines.text: Pig!
lines.character: Pepita, Another Dancer of Equal Temperament

lines.text: Beast!
lines.character: Antonita, a Dancer of Passionate Temperament

lines.text: Stone!
lines.character: Pepita, Another Dancer of Equal Temperament

lines.text: Weasel!
lines.character: Antonita, a Dancer of Passionate Temperament

lines.text: Worm!
lines.character: Pepita, Another Dancer of Equal Temperament

lines.text: Tell me, has Don Juan been very tired lately?
lines.character: Dona Dolores, a Lady of Mystery

lines.text: How did you know?
lines.character: Leporello

lines.text: Ha-ha-ha. No great lover has any secrets from a woman after a year.
lines.character: Dona Dolores, a Lady of Mystery

lines.text: Dona Dolores, you're bound to win.
lines.character: Leporello

lines.text: I might. But, now I must wait. He'll soon be tired of being tired.
lines.character: Dona Dolores, a Lady of Mystery

lines.text: What does he got to say to me?
lines.character: Dona Dolores, a Lady of Mystery

lines.text: What a fool he was to forget all this. The divine hair. And those two lovely stars. Just a little frightened.
lines.character: Don Juan

lines.text: No-no-no, darling. You told me all that six years ago. Tell me some of the wonderful things that made women dazed and intoxicated.
lines.character: Dona Dolores, a Lady of Mystery

lines.text: Well, that was it. That's what I always told them.
lines.character: Don Juan

lines.text: Well, then, tell me something you never told any woman before.
lines.character: Dona Dolores, a Lady of Mystery

lines.text: I love you, darling. I don't want to be anything but your husband.
lines.character: Don Juan

lines.text: Ha-ha-ha. Won't you ever learn anything about women? Every woman wants something more than just a husband. Every woman wants Don Juan; but, all to herself.
lines.character: Dona Dolores, a Lady of Mystery
